org.openadaptor.auxil.connector.jdbc.reader
Interface IResultSetConverter

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractResultSetConverter
public interface IResultSetConverter

Interface for convertion of an SQL ResultSet into Object record(s). The resultant record types is ultimately determined by the implementation classes.

Since:
Post 3.2.1
Author:
higginse

Field Summary
static int CONVERT_ALL
          This indicates that all rows from a ResultSet should be converted.
static int CONVERT_ONE
          Flag to indicate converter shoudl convert a single row at a time.
static int DEFAULT_BATCH_SIZE
          This is the default batch size for converting a ResultSet.
 
Method Summary
 java.lang.Object[] convert(java.sql.ResultSet rs, int maxBatchSize)
          Convert rows from ResultSet into corresponding record Objects.

Method Detail

convert

public java.lang.Object[] convert(java.sql.ResultSet rs,
                                  int maxBatchSize)
                           throws java.sql.SQLException
Convert rows from ResultSet into corresponding record Objects.

Parameters:
rs -
maxBatchSize - sets upper limit on number of records which may be converted from the ResultSet.
Returns:
Object[] with at most maxBatchSize records, unless maxBatchSize is CONVERT_ALL where all records will be converted.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException
